title: Coverage strategies - it's ironic that insurers want to spread quake risk
author: Unknown
text: I find your Feb. 1 article regarding the insurance industry lobbying Congress to force commercial building owners and homeowners to buy earthquake insurance ironic.     They want to spread the risk because of unknown costs for natural disasters. Then for things with known costs that are profitable like health care, they want to pick and choose. I mean only the young and healthy. They could have done the same with health-care insurance. If everyone had to have it the cost could be brought down by spreading the risk! Instead, the insurance companies spent millions of dollars to defeat health-care reform nationally and are trying to do the same in this state right now.     The insurance companies love to collect premiums but hate to take any risk. Wouldn't we all! Walt Carol Seatt
